vignette.name: Object Explorer
vignette.bodytext: The Object Explorer replaces the older Max Object Palette. It is a searchable and categorized listing of Max, MSP, and Jitter object as well as all of the patchers located in your search path. It adds a number of novel ways for browsing and discovering Max objects to the earlier object-box-based search methods, and adds an the integrated search field and autocompletion features youâ€™ll find in several places in the Max interface. As before, you can patch directly from the Object Explorer by dragging objects into a patcher window.

bluebox.bodytext: There are several ways of displaying the Object Explorer.

ul.li: Click on the Show Object Explorer button in the toolbar of an unlocked Patcher window.
Click on the Sidebar button in the toolbar of an unlocked Patcher window. The Object Explorer will be displayed in the opened Sidebar panel.
Double-click anywhere in the blank space in an unlocked Patcher window.

bluebox.bodytext: You can also type the letter "p" (Palette).

The Object Explorer displays icons for the objects available to you in Max sorted by their category. The precise makeup of the Object Explorer will vary based on what objects you have installed, but the objects in each category are listed in alphabetical order.

vignette.bodytext: You can scroll the Object Explorer vertically to see the full listing of categories of Max objects and their contents. Note: The scroll bar is only visible while scrolling or when you position your cursor along the right-hand edge of the Object Explorer window.
Every Max object belongs to a category. Each category has a disclosure triangle to you can use to show or hide its contents.
The upper portion of the Object Explorer contains a number of buttons and menus you can use to refine your searches and investigations.

bluebox.bodytext: The Show bar of the Object Explorer includes a number of view selectors that allow you to look for objects and Max patches according to their type or use.

ul.li: UI Objects will display user interface objects only
Max, MSP, and Jitter view selectors will display only Max, MSP, or Jitter objects.

The Patchers view selector is a menu that displays selection options that correspond to different kinds of Max patches that may be stored in your search path. Selections are availble for different varieties of abstractions, (sorted according to their content) bpatchers, and special-purpose patchers associated with the Max gen objects.
Click on a view selector in the Object Explorer to show a subset of Max objects. The display will update to show only those objects in each of the category tabs.

bluebox.bodytext: The Object Explorer also lets you refine your search for Max objects by their category using the Go To Category/Search bar. The menu items available under the Go To Category menu varies and is determined by what set of objects are currently visible in the object explorer as set by the Show bar's view selector buttons.
The Go To Category menu always contains a Show All item. Selecting this item will will show all categories in the Object Explorer related to the Show Bar's view selector settings.

Note: The list of categories available under the categories menu is determined by what set of objects are currently visible in the object explorer - categories are only available for visible objects and that is determined by the state of the show buttons and filter field settings.

ul.li: Click on the down arrow to show the menu of Category choices currently available.
When you release the mouse, the Object Explorer will close all categories except the one you've selected.

bluebox.bodytext: The Object Explorer includes a search window you can use to narrow down your search or to browse for objects.
Note: The search window returns matches based on the current Explorer settings based on the Go To Category and Show settings. You can changes these settings as you type to direct your search.

ul.li: Click in the Object Explorer's Search window to get a cursor and start typing. As you do, the object explorer will modify its display to suggest objects you should investigate further.
